title: In 1992, when Carl Malamud was working as a consultant for the ITU on the Internet, he noted that the telephones in ITU headquarters were all models whose technology dated to World War II. title: Introduction: Epistemic Communities and International Policy Coordination
A New World Order
The Long Emergency: Surviving the End of Oil, Climate Change, and Other Converging Catastrophes of the Twenty-First Century
Ordering Chaos: Regulating the Internet
A Third-World perspective on what Internet governance means
Reforming Internet Governance: Perspectives from the Working Group on Internet Governance (WGIG
A collective memoir of the work of the working group that set the stage for the Internet Governance Forum
The Future of Ideas: The Fate of the Commons in a Connected World
A thorough discussion about problems with intellectual property in the Internet Age
The World Intellectual Property Organization: Resurgence and the Development Agenda
A thorough but readable study of one of the formal international organizations that is concerned with Internet governance
Internet Governance: A Grand Collaboration
A compilation of thoughtful essays that was very influential in shaping the issue
Ruling the Root: Internet Governance and the Taming of Cyberspace
A study of the early, and somewhat tempestuous period of the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers
